title: Saltwater crocs locked in furious battle after female wandered into dominant male 'Otis's' territory
text:
Two saltwater crocodiles have been filmed in a violent brawl after an unsuspecting female wandered into the territory of Otis, the dominant male.

Matthew Right, star of television show Monster Croc Wrangler, uploaded a video of the fight to Instagram on Tuesday.

The fight, which happened in the Northern Territory's Top End, shows dominant male 'Otis' attacking a female crocodile, latching onto her tail with his giant mouth before rolling on the ground and twisting her body.

'This is one of the craziest things I’ve seen to date,' Mr Wright said on Instagram.

Matthew Right, star of television show Monster Croc Wrangler, uploaded a video of the fight to Instagram on Tuesday

Mr Wright said he had to distract Otis to save the life of the female crocodile.

'We had to put our phones down to get me a stick,' Mr Wright said.

'I managed to make enough noise in the periphery to distract Otis so he let go of her.'

Though the female crocodile was likely injured during the fight, Mr Wright claimed she was lucky.

'People often ask me how crocs lose limbs. It’s in battles like this one,' he said.

'I was so happy that in this instance the little girl got away all in one piece.'

Otis attacks the female crocodile by latching onto her tail with his giant mouth before rolling on the ground and twisting her body

Many commenters were shocked by the footage as they had never seen the brutality of a crocodile fight.

'Thank god he let go of her. This was difficult to watch,' one person said.

Another said: 'Wow. Amazing footage of what nature truly is.'

One commenter was angry at Otis for attacking a female.

'Otis is a punk he beat up on a female that did nothing to him,' the commenter said.
